title: New York's streets? Not so mean any more
description: In this funny and thought-provoking talk, Janette Sadik-Khan, transportation commissioner of New York City, shares projects that have reshaped street life in the 5 boroughs, including pedestrian zones in Times Square, high-performance buses and a 6,000-cycle-strong bike share. Her mantra: Do bold experiments that are cheap to try out.
author: Janette Sadik-Khan
keywords: TED, talks, architecture, cities, design, transportation, infrastructure
